snippet: It was a day of paperwork, pleading and raised or dashed hopes for New York City students who were seeking to transfer, or to just get into any school at all.
abstract: Many students and parents across New York City spend first day of school year in bureaucratic limbo, waiting in lines at registration centers;  some hope to obtain transfers while others have yet to be assigned any school at all.

byline.contributor: Elizabeth A. Harris and Kyle Spencer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: It was a day of paperwork, pleading and raised or dashed hopes for New York City students who were seeking to transfer, or to just get into any school at all.

headline.main: A First Day of School Spent in Limbo Instead of in Class
headline.print_headline: A First Day of School Spent in Limbo Instead of in Class
